intro: Oxydectes atrata, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow petals and dark brown central disk. The plant typically grows in open fields and along roadsides, thriving in full sun. It produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its widespread distribution. Oxydectes atrata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
